Reviews.Title: “ok close to graceland”
Reviews.Author: bangorgooner
Reviews.Content: We arrived after along drive from Atlanta and were tired. We looked like we were in the wrong side of town and were impressed by the electric gates. We took a room which was ok and functional the breakfast was dire but the staff allowed us to leave the car there while we went to graceland a saving of $10 which was appreciated. Not a great hotel but it was ok

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, close to Graceland”
Reviews.Author: Dgo_Guy
Reviews.Content: For the area, this is an ok hotel. The rooms were very large though old and in need of work, i.e. paint and remodeling. Hotel was dog friendly, though they charge by the day and it seems a bit expensive if you stay for more than one day. Graceland is a couple of blocks away. BUT, this is not the nicest part of Memphis, though the hotel certainly seems secure. A few blocks north, on Brooks, not nice at all. Staff was friendly and its an ok stay if you are going to Graceland and that's why you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own sheets ...”
Reviews.Author: Lu_and_deek
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this place is close to Graceland, plus .. has a decent pool, plus .. the room was big, plus ... rate was reasonable, plus. Sheets were not very clean looking, double minus ... bed was not comfy, minus .. outside our door had a smell of curry and pee, minus ... front desk lady did not have very good customer service skills (not rude, just not coming across as happy to see customers), minus. Overall not a terrible experience, but having to sleep fully clothed because the sheets left you wondering if they had been washed left an overall negative impression .. will not stay here nor suggest staying here to anyone we know or anyone taking the time to read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Rheafly
Reviews.Content: The hotel room we has was clean and the bulding is gated but the staff is very rude and will nickel and dime you for everything. First I called and asked if there were any rooms available and was told there where and it was $65 a night. When we arrived I asked the night worker for a two bed room and he said they were sold out. When I told him we would just keep looking he magically found a double bed room. Then I was told the room was $85, even though I had just called. They charge $5 to use thier computer in the lobby and $25 per pet. The fruit for the breakfast was old and there are signs everywhere stating you can not take the food out of the lobby. The beds are very hard and the pool is small. There are plenty of hotels in the area so I would skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive- don't believe ANYTHING they say!”
Reviews.Author: NoneReally
Reviews.Content: Scottish Inn and Suites was recommened to me for ease of access to Graceland...or so it was thought. Wanting to stay a week for Elvis Week so I call the hotel and inquire about a room. "plenty to choose from". So I went to their site to select a room and booked a 'guaranteed' reservation using my credit card. This was early 2011. After I booked they had 9 rooms left. Less than 2 months before my arrival date they call to tell me they are giving my room away to someone else. They have people willing to pay for more nights if they can get a room there....so they are kicking people out of their reservations to accomodate those who are willing to spend more....so it appears. Corporate was contacted who spoke with the local hotel.... which fed them bull about being booked solid all along. (yeah, right) Corporate requests no evidence of such and simply tells me to look elsewhere. Don't plan a trip to Graceland thinking you have a room here even if you have an email confirmation with a 'guarantee' reservation. They can, and will kick you out if someone is willing to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, room okay”
Reviews.Author: gravimetrix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night - we arrived 1 day earlier than planned in Memphis (booked Days Inn for the following night) so found this Scottish Inn on Elvis Presley Blvd - it looked okay from the outside and had rooms available so thought we'd give it a go... First impressions were terrible - went in to reception and was basically ignored for 5 or 6 minutes, despite ringing the bell for attention. The staff were in a room right around the corner from the reception so must have known that customers were waiting. When the receptionist finally appeared we had no apology - in fact she was quite dismissive and rude to us - a very "matter of fact" tone and didn't volunteer any information about the room. A very, very poor reception and this set the scene for this hotel for our stay. The room itself was large and adequate - nothing special for the high rate we were charged though. My advice - stay at Days Inn down the road - see my review - staff much, much nicer and right next to Graceland.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: vibs73
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to Scottish Inn the owner explained that she had one room left. After a long drive from Texas my friend and I decided to take it. We were given a smoking room without warning (Iâ€™m allergic to smoke) but because it was already midnight I thought I would try to suck it up by leaving the windows open. I inspected the bed for bud bugs. Good news was I did not find any bed bugs; however, the sheets appeared used and hair was all over the sheets, pillows and mattress cover. The pillows were covered in stains and had a disgusting stench. The bathroom had a strong odor of urine and hair on the floor and in the tub. At that point, we decided ask for a refund. The owner charged us $10.00 because she had to pay somebody to remake the bed. I would rather sleep on the sidewalk than stay at this place. If I could give this hotel a rating of zero I would. Stay far away from the Scottish Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: beastwar
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and quiet rooms were very clean the owner was very courtious the parking was gated which was nice because of driving a mustang convertible would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were very rude and not at all helpful”
Reviews.Author: pissed_offMissourri
Reviews.Content: Female 'Owner' was extremely rude and not at all helpful. Needs a lesson in etiquette and social graces and should not be on the Reception Desk. I would never recommend this place to anyone to stay. Over priced for the weekend especially and the breakfast was stale and the coffee was undrinkable. Again the femal owner watched every move we made in the breakfast room in case we ate too much food. The internet was advertised as being free and we were charged for using it for 5 mins. No sign was up to show there was a fee. A total rip off place.

Reviews.Title: “Good motel near graceland”
Reviews.Author: harrison45
Reviews.Content: Good quality motel colse to graceland, reasonably priced, rooms very large, spotlessly clean, fridge, microwave, free breakfeast, cereal, coffee, juice, toast and buns. Not much nightlife round graceland area, only a few eating houses, but can get free shutle bus to sun studio from graceland during daytime last returning 6pm, or get a taxi back later. All in all it provided a great base for my stay in memphis, and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: andy5161
Reviews.Content: We wouldn't stay here again. We were give a room which had an awful smell to so we asked to be moved to another room. The receptionist moved us with no fuss but didn't amend the records and at 4:30am we were awoken by two drunken people trying to enter our room (very frightening). When we had moved rooms the receptionist had forgotten to amend the records and went off shift and the replacement issued the room to these two people who were drunk, loud and aggressive. We had no apology from the front desk and none of the staff were really friendly at all, they didn't seem bothered if we stayed there or not. The breakfast next morning was not very good either, the coffee was weak and the bread stale. We left and went to a diner. Overall disappointment-won't go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good For the Price.”
Reviews.Author: ctepsick
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. We had a nice stay without any major problems. The only thing I didn't like were the employees were neither friendly nor helpful with the local area. Also, the continental breakfast was one of the worst I have ever experienced. Also, I got in "trouble" for trying to leave with a Honey Bun. I would recommend this hotel for it's great price, but don't expect much in regards to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “On a Rainy Night in Memphis--we found GOOD LODGIN'”
Reviews.Author: ontgoMN
Reviews.Content: It was raining. We were travel weary on day 10 of a cross country December vacation. Neither of us was in the mood for a crappy big city hotel. So, I suggested the Scottish having I think stayed in that hotel brand and remembering it to be reasonablly priced and nice. I had never stayed at the one in Memphis. It was an itty bitty hotel not far from Graceland. I felt very safe there and the room was nicely decorated and super clean. We didn't pay very much for a suite and it was so comfortable, the bed and pillows were soft. I would recommend this place to any traveler. Truly a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price - and for Graceland”
Reviews.Author: Guzzle
Reviews.Content: The Scottish Inn is about seven minutes' walk to Graceland, in an otherwise far from thrilling area, but perfect for those who want to beat the crowds and get in line early. Rooms are spacious and really clean, although there were more cigarette burns in the bed cover than one would normally expect in a non smoking room... Staff is friendly and helpful. Those who don't want to drive can avail of the Pink Limo Hotel Shuttle (ask for a menu when you check in) and get driven to Marlowe's Ribs Restaurant further down the boulevard for tasty barbecue. Yum! The pool's not terribly enticing, unless you find the concept of swimming four feet away from 18-wheelers and a constant stream of traffic appealing...

Reviews.Title: “Stonekeeper Road Trip Days 2 and 3”
Reviews.Author: stonekeeper
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights to see Graceland and Beale st on a road trip to Las Vegas and back to Chicago. External corridor motel felt fairly modern. Be careful to drive slowly on and off the car park to avoid grounding. Was recommended by the staff and security guard at Graceland. Quick check in.The price reflects it's closeness to Graceland, about 170 yards. Fully clean and functional room. We thought it ideal for our purpose. Breakfast in the lobby. We ate evening meals at the Piccadilly further down the EPB.Good buffet. Staff pleasant and efficient both at the Motel and restraunt/cafe

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PriyeshP
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service, Safe Property, Big Rooms, Nothing else to say

Reviews.Title: “very clean nice staff”
Reviews.Author: lovebeingamommy
Reviews.Content: This was very nice and last moment booking. It was very close to graceland and just a short drive to Beale St. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful business practice of booking people then not having the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: elvisgirl77
Reviews.Content: They business practices sholud be investigated.. I stayed there last year and before I checked out they had me make out a form for this year and gave me rooms 111 & 112. I left my credit # with them because they wanted to make sure those guests that had stayed with them would get first choice before they made rooms available for others. I talked to the manager in Dec because i heard there rumors of problems and she assured me I had 2 rooms. Well I didn't after all. I do now and I'm staying in Ms. I will do and say anything to bad mouth this hotel and give their owners a bad name. Don't stay there unless thats all thats available. Better yet you'd be better off sleeping in your car. Kathy

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Honor their Word”
Reviews.Author: EPFan
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed 7 nights at this hotel during Elvis Week last Aug 2006. The hotel was not inexpensive - $139/night plus tax. If was a decent room - larger than most and relatively clean based on Memphis standards (we go to Memphis every Aug and have stayed in many Graceland area sub-par hotels over the years). The rate was ridiculously high for the caliber of hotel and the area of Memphis, but it is walking distance to Graceland so we opted to bear the expense. When we checked out, we asked for the 3rd time that week if we could please make reservations for Aug 2007 as it was a "big" year for Elvis fans (30th anniversary of Elvis' passing). Each time, we advised we'd be happy to provide a credit card deposit but were told in each case that reservations for Aug 2007 could not be made until 2/1/07. When we left, we asked for a business card from the hotel desk manager that would ensure we had a name of the person who last advised us we could not make a reservation. She provided a card, and advised us that it was a family owned hotel (family lives on site), and that we would not have any problems getting a room. Today is 1/31/07, and we tried to call to make reservations for August (a day earlier than they advised), only to be told that the hotel was already sold out. No matter how many times we communicated that we had been advised to wait until 2/1/07, we were told, "Sorry - we have no rooms." When we located the business card they gave us last August, we realized there was no individual's name on the card. We were stuck. This is the equivilant of trying to get a room for a large convention 6 months after most of the desirable hotels are full. Now, we will be forced to stay in a hotel over the state line in Mississippi, as all of Memphis is sold out. I would not recommend staying at this hotel as they do not honor their word. I can't imagine they get more traffic than the Elvis fans that stay there in Aug and Jan and pay ridiculously high rates - and the fans are very loyal to a hotel that treats them right. There are hotels in Memphis that have gone out of business because the fans stopped staying there due to bad experiences. As an Elvis fan, I'd like other fans to know that if you think you have a reservation at the Scottish Inn and don't have a printed confirmation number on the hotel's letterhead, plan on bringing your sleeping bag to Memphis in August. You'll need it.

HotelInfo.Name: Scottish Inn And Suite Memphis
HotelInfo.Address: 3524 Elvis Presley Boulevard, Memphis, TN 38116
